Understate: The claim may understate the fact that all but two of the 12 Republican House members who voted against the awarding of the Congressional Gold Medal did support alternative proposals to recognize and honor the U.S. Capitol Police for their actions during the Jan. 6 attack.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support as it does not provide specific evidence or sources to back up the statement that 12 Republican House members voted against the awarding of the Congressional Gold Medal.
Problematic assumption: The claim may make a problematic assumption that the vote against the awarding of the Congressional Gold Medal automatically implies a lack of support or recognition for the U.S. Capitol Police officers' actions during the Jan. 6 attack.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the 12 Republican House members who voted against the awarding of the Congressional Gold Medal may have had valid reasons or concerns that led to their decision.
